com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WindowsInfoConnectionParameters

All Known Subinterfaces:
WinRMInfoConnectionParameters, WMIInfoConnectionParameters
public interface WindowsInfoConnectionParameters

Root interface used to define connection-specific parameters used by WindowsInfoService to establish connections with remote windows machines.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getHostname()
          Return the name of the target system (hostname or IP address) that these parameters define a connection for.
 java.lang.String getNamespace()
          Return the namespace that queries executed on the target system will run under.
 java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTags()
          Return a collection of strings that will be associated with credential events reported when this connection is opened.
 long getTimeout()
          Return the timeout value (in milliseconds) that should be applied when a connection is established using these parameters.
 void setHostname(java.lang.String hostname)
          Set the name of the target system (hostname or IP address) that these parameters define a connection for.
 void setNamespace(java.lang.String namespace)
          Update the namespace that queries executed on the target system will run under.
 void setTags(java.lang.String... tags)
          Replace the collection of strings attached to events generated when a connection is opened using these parameters.
 void setTimeout(long timeout)
          Set a timeout value that will be used when connections are established using these parameters.
 

Method Detail

getHostname

java.lang.String getHostname()
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Return the name of the target system (hostname or IP address) that these parameters define a connection for. A hostname must be set on this object before this method can be used. Failure to do so will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown.

Returns:
The target system's hostname or IP address
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - A hostname has not been set on this object yet

getNamespace

java.lang.String getNamespace()
Return the namespace that queries executed on the target system will run under. The default value is root/cimv2. This method will never return null.

Returns:
The namespace queries executed on the target system will run under

getTags

java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTags()
Return a collection of strings that will be associated with credential events reported when this connection is opened. These are often used by cartridges to correlate events in the FMS with the activities of agents attempting to collect data.

Returns:
The tags to associate with credential events generated by connections opened with these parameters

getTimeout

long getTimeout()
Return the timeout value (in milliseconds) that should be applied when a connection is established using these parameters.

Returns:
The number of milliseconds to use as a timeout value when this connection is established

setHostname

void setHostname(java.lang.String hostname)
Set the name of the target system (hostname or IP address) that these parameters define a connection for. It is illegal to provide a null value for the target host name.

Parameters:
hostname - The new name of the target host to connect to
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided hostname is null.

setNamespace

void setNamespace(java.lang.String namespace)
Update the namespace that queries executed on the target system will run under.

Parameters:
namespace - The new namespace to execute queries under
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provide namespace is null.

setTags

void setTags(java.lang.String... tags)
Replace the collection of strings attached to events generated when a connection is opened using these parameters. These tags are often used by cartridges to correlate events reported to the FMS with the activites of agents attempting to perform work on their behalf.

Parameters:
tags - The tags to associate with credential events generated when a connetion is opened with these parameters

setTimeout

void setTimeout(long timeout)
Set a timeout value that will be used when connections are established using these parameters. A value of zero indicates no timeout.

Parameters:
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the connection to be established
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided timeout parameter is less than zero
